File core/array.js

file core/array.js

Function Summary
public void _each ( iterator, context)
This method is required for mixin in the enumerable module. Uses javascript 1.6 native implementation if present.
public Array clear()
Clears the array (makes it empty) and returns the array reference.
public Array clone()
Returns a duplicate of the array, leaving the original array intact.
public ? first()
Returns array's first item (e.g. array[0]).
public int indexOf (? item, [int offset])
Returns the index of the first occurrence of item within the array, or -1 if item doesn't exist in the array. Compares items using *strict equality* (===).
public ? last()
Returns array's last item (e.g. array[array.length - 1]).
public int lastIndexOf (? item, [int offset])
Returns the position of the last occurrence of item within the array or -1 if item doesn't exist in the array.
public Array remove (? item)
Remove given item from this array instance. Note if multiple occurences of this item are present, only the first one is removed.
public Array removeAt (int index)
Remove item at specified index. Modifies this instance of array.

Function Details

function _each

public void _each( iterator, context)
This method is required for mixin in the enumerable module. Uses javascript 1.6 native implementation if present.
Parameters:
iterator
context

function clear

public Array clear()
Clears the array (makes it empty) and returns the array reference.
Example:
  var stuff = ['Apple', 'Orange', 'Juice', 'Blue'];
  stuff.clear();
  // -> []
  stuff
  // -> []
Returns:
new string with all whiteshapce removed from the start and end of this string

function clone

public Array clone()
Returns a duplicate of the array, leaving the original array intact.

function first

public ? first()
Returns array's first item (e.g. array[0]).

function indexOf

public int indexOf(? item, [int offset])
Returns the index of the first occurrence of item within the array, or -1 if item doesn't exist in the array. Compares items using *strict equality* (===).
Example:
  [3, 5, 6, 1, 20].indexOf(1)
  // -> 3

  [3, 5, 6, 1, 20].indexOf(90)
  // -> -1 (not found)

  ['1', '2', '3'].indexOf(1);
  // -> -1 (not found, 1 !== '1')
Parameters:
item - value that may or may not be in the array.
[offset] - number of initial items to skip before beginning the search.
Returns:
index of first occurence of item in the array or -1 if not found.

function last

public ? last()
Returns array's last item (e.g. array[array.length - 1]).

function lastIndexOf

public int lastIndexOf(? item, [int offset])
Returns the position of the last occurrence of item within the array or -1 if item doesn't exist in the array.
Parameters:
item - value that may or may not be in the array.
[offset] - number of items at the end to skip before beginning the search.
Returns:
position of the last occurrence of item within the array or -1 if not found
See also:
indexOf

function remove

public Array remove(? item)
Remove given item from this array instance. Note if multiple occurences of this item are present, only the first one is removed.
Parameters:
item - remove this item from array
Returns:
this array instance

function removeAt

public Array removeAt(int index)
Remove item at specified index. Modifies this instance of array.
Parameters:
index - index to remove item at
Returns:
this array instance
